summary: toxoplasma gondii is an obligate intracellular protozoan parasite that can infect mammalian cells. the long non-coding RNAs (lncRNAs) regulate host gene expression. the role of host lncRNAs in the response to T. gondii infection remains largely unknown. infection-induced lncRNA expression is a novel mechanism by which the Toxoplasma parasite regulates host immune signaling. electronic supplementary material The online version of this article contains supplementary material. transfection of shRNA-NONHSAT022487 into HFF and THP-1 cells.
